page.title: 18OUR DOMESDAY AREA
page.content: The area in which we have to do our Domesday study is only small but quite unique.In terms of natural vegetation one of the most common plants is the beautiful rhododendron with its large characteristic purple blooms which appear in a never ending supply in spring and early summer.These shrubs thrive on the acidic soil of the area and are a common sight in the driveways and gardens of local people. Being originally heathland,woodland and bog there are many fine examples of original deciduous trees and introduced coniferous trees which give a shaded aspect to many of the gardens of the area.Up until recent years any 'waste'land was probably there because of it being poorly-drained bog. These areas are fast disappearing under a mountain of new housing estates as engineers become expert in drainage.
